data.author: Ian Donnelly

changelog.release_notes: SportsOfficial finally supports colors! Users with color devices will now see colors when they update SportsOfficial. I don't yet own a Pebble Time so I haven't been able to see how to results will actually pan out so user feedback is greatly appreciated. Also the app is now compatible with SDK3. Look for some code cleanup and newer features coming soon!
The settings page has been rewritten to make it much better looking. It also allows the user to cancel updating the settings.

data.description:
SportsOfficial is a scorekeeping app which allows users to keep track of score and time for nearly any sport! The app includes stopwatch functionality to keep track of the time of a sporting event, as well as score keeping functionality for two teams. 

Users can keep track of scores for two teams by using either the Up button (Home Team) or Down button (Away Team). The app supports single clicks, double clicks, and long clicks to change the score. Clicks can be customized for most sports by changing the score increments to match any sport (for instance, 1, 2, and 3 points for basketball or 1, 3, and 6 points for football).

This the perfect app for score keepers, referees, or sport enthusiasts!

To-Do:
- Make this page way better looking.

Notes: 
- This is my first published app of any kind, so if you find any bugs or have any feature requests please let me know!
- This app began life as a school project; I want to thank TJ Taylor and Javier Lores who I worked with on the project and who helped write that version of the app.

I don't yet own a Pebble Time so I haven't been able to see how to results will actually pan out so user feedback is greatly appreciated. Also the app is now compatible with SDK3. Look for some code cleanup and newer features coming soon!
